measured_by: Reading the Mind in the Eyes (RME) test
justification: “Each participant also completed a standard 'Reading the Mind in the Eyes' (RME) test, which is commonly used as a measure of social perceptiveness.”

measured_by: Sum of scores on two hard Room Assignment (CSOP) tasks
justification: “Skill : defined as the sum of the participant's score on the two hard room assignment tasks … we use participants' scores on the two hard tasks to measure skill levels.”

measured_by: Total time spent solving hard Room Assignment tasks
justification: “speed (fast vs. slow), which is decided by whether the total amount of time the participant spent on solving the hard instances … is below or above the median.”

topic_or_construct: Cognitive style – problem-solving style (pragmatic vs. tenacious)
measured_by: Exit-survey question about behaviour after assigning all students
justification: “problem-solving style … is decided by the participant's self-reported answer for the exit-survey question ‘If you had assigned all students to rooms and had no conflicts, which of the following would you be most likely to do?’.”

topic_or_construct: Cognitive style – constraint violation tolerance (low vs. high)
measured_by: Exit-survey question about handling conflicts during assignment
justification: “constraint violation tolerance … is decided by the participant's self-reported answer for the exit-survey question ‘If you had assigned some (but not all) students to rooms and had encountered one or more conflicts, what would you do?’.”

topic_or_construct: Cognitive style – problem-solving focus (optimizer vs. satisficer)
measured_by: Exit-survey question on focus when assigning a student
justification: “problem-solving focus … is decided by the participant's self-reported answer for the exit-survey question ‘When assigning a student to a room, what did you focus more on?’.”
